question: I am the sitting governor of Louisiana. My given first name is Piyush, but you can call me:
name: Bobby Jindal
otherpossiblenameoptions: Rand Paul, Lincoln Chaffee, Marco Rubio

question: I am the former governor of Maryland. I signed laws making some undocumented immigrants eligible for in-state tuition and legalizing gay marriage. My name is:
name: Martin O'Malley
otherpossiblenameoptions: Ben Carson, George Pataki, John Kasich

question: I’m Rhode Island’s governor. So was my dad. I used to be the Senate’s most liberal Republican. Then I became an independent. Now I’m running as a Democrat. I am:
name: John Kasich
otherpossiblenameoptions: Martin O'Malley, Rick Santorum, Ben Carson

question: This is a gimme: I’m a former first lady, former U.S. Senator, former Secretary of State. You know my husband. You know me. I’m:
summary: former United States Secretary of State, former U.S. Senator from New York, and former U.S. Presidential candidate in 2008, has taken positions on many political issues through her public comments and based on her senatorial voting record.
name: Hillary Clinton
otherpossiblenameoptions: Lindsey Graham, Carly Fiorina, Chris Christie

question: I was a professor of neurosurgery at Johns Hopkins – and the first to separate twins conjoined at the head. I was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom. I’m a bestselling author, and conservatives love me:
name: Ben Carson
otherpossiblenameoptions: John Kasich, Mike Huckabee, Rick Santorum

question: I ran for president in 2012 and won 11 primaries. I’ve been controversial -- I once called intelligent design a legitimate scientific theory, though my view has since … evolved. I lost my Senate seat for being more hawkish than President Bush. I am:
name: Rick Santorum
otherpossiblenameoptions: Scott Walker, Ted Cruz, Rick Perry

question: I'm a U.S. Senator from Kentucky. My dad ran for president in 2008 and 2012. He's a libertarian, and I lean that way as well. I am:
name: Rand Paul
otherpossiblenameoptions: Jeb Bush, Rick Santorum, Rick Perry

question: I'm the U.S. Senator from Texas whose efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act led to the government shutdown in 2013. I am:
name: Ted Cruz
otherpossiblenameoptions: Rick Perry, Jeb Bush, Marco Rubio

question: I'm a former CEO of Hewlett-Packard. I lost my campaign for Senate in California in 2010, so if I make it to the White House, it'll be my first time in public office. I am:
summary: Fiorina hopes to shrink federal spending, reform the tax code and outfit all police with body cameras. But because she faces stiff competition from people with clearer voter bases and more experience in government -- and because she's focused on contrasting herself to likely Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton -- her run is largely seen as a way to get a VP nod from whoever actually gets the Republican nomination.
name: Carly Fiorina
otherpossiblenameoptions: Lindsey Graham, Chris Christie, Hillary Clinton

question: I was governor of Arkansas before running for president in 2008 and landing a hosting gig on Fox News. I'm hoping to win more than just the Iowa caucuses this time around.
name: Mike Huckabee

question: I've represented South Carolina in both the House and the Senate. Unlike more libertarian-leaning members of my party, I am hawkish on foreign policy. I also riled up some fellow Republicans by supporting immigration reform.
name: Lindsey Graham
